chapter.heading: MISCELLANEOUS INVESTIGATION REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER DUTIES

subsection.heading: Review of Fatalities.—
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary of the Army shall conduct a multidisciplinary, impartial review (referred to as a “fatality review”) in the case of each fatality known or suspected to have resulted from domestic violence or child abuse against any of the following:

paragraph.content: A member of the Army on active duty.
A current or former dependent of a member of the Army on active duty.
A current or former intimate partner who has a child in common or has shared a common domicile with a member of the Army on active duty.

subsection.heading: Matters To Be Included.—
subsection.chapeau: The report of a fatality review under subsection (a) shall, at a minimum, include the following:

paragraph.content: Data setting forth victim demographics, injuries, autopsy findings, homicide or suicide methods, weapons, police information, assailant demographics, and household and family information.
System intervention and failures, if any, within the Department of Defense.
Recommendations for systemic changes, if any, within the Department of the Army and the Department of Defense.

subsection.heading: OSD Guidance.—
subsection.content: The Secretary of Defense shall prescribe guidance, which shall be uniform for the military departments, for the conduct of reviews by the Secretary under subsection (a).
